title: Pepper-Sprayed While Pinned Down: A Searing Scene Provokes Outrage
summary: Images of a man getting pepper-sprayed at close range while being held down by Border Patrol agents fueled more tension in Minneapolis.

title: Why the Power May Not Go Out Until After the Storm Has Passed
summary: The steady accumulation of snow and freezing rain and a rise in demand for electricity can cause problems long after the sky clears, energy experts said.

title: Trump Threatens Canada With Tariffs as Post-Davos Fallout Continues
summary: President Trump said he would impose tariffs if Canada made “a deal with China,” though there is no sign that those countries are discussing a broad trade agreement.

title: Despite Trump’s Words, China and Russia Are Not Threatening Greenland
summary: U.S. and European officials say they are unaware of any intelligence that shows China and Russia are endangering the island, which is protected by the NATO security umbrella.

title: What Europe Learned From the Greenland Crisis
summary: Territorial integrity is a core tenet of Europe that is at risk from Russian and American imperialism. Brussels has fought back.

title: How a Year of Trump Changed Britain
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer stood firm over Greenland. But his center-left government and the country as a whole have been buffeted by President Trump.

title: As Trump Focuses Abroad, G.O.P. Toils to Hone Election Message
summary: A new poll shows that voters who will decide control of Congress see a lack of presidential emphasis on critical domestic issues.

title: Low Rates Sound Great. But a Trump Fed Could Cause a Painful ‘Sugar High.’
summary: Dropping rates more than conditions warrant would stimulate the economy in the short term but could lead to trouble, our columnist says.

title: Should New Dietary Guidelines Change How You Eat? Your Biggest Questions, Answered.
summary: New federal nutrition advice has caused some confusion and controversy.

title: Genetic Data From Over 20,000 U.S. Children Misused for ‘Race Science’
summary: The National Institutes of Health failed to protect brain scans that an international group of fringe researchers used to argue for the intellectual superiority of white people.

title: The World Will Remember Trump’s Greenland Outburst
summary: It is time for Americans to step up and defend NATO and our country’s vital interests in its survival.

title: Cold Comfort
summary: How can the perpetually shivering warm up to winter?

title: An Antarctic Mission to Recover a Robot’s Data
summary: In the unforgiving polar wilderness, scientists go to great lengths to safeguard the devices that gather precious data.

title: Setting Foot on the Melting Thwaites Glacier
summary: Bad weather ​delayed expedition scientists’​ ​efforts to set up camp on Thwaites Glacier ​in Antarctica ​and take measurements ​to determine how quickly it is melting. After the skies cleared, our journalists​, Raymond Zhong and Chang W. Lee​, took us along for their first steps on Thwaites.

title: Washington Post Tears Up Plans to Cover Winter Olympics
summary: The abrupt change in direction came just weeks before the Olympic Games are set to begin in Italy.

title: 1 Killed and 14 Injured in Fire at Bronx Apartment Building
summary: About 150 homes were evacuated overnight on Saturday after a gas explosion set off a four-alarm blaze in a public housing complex.

title: How a Water Balloon Fight in Venezuela Ended in Charges of Treason
summary: Venezuela’s interim government has been praised by President Trump. It has also maintained its state security apparatus to stamp out any perceived dissent.

title: Mamdani Joined Nurses on the Picket Lines. That’s Unusual for Mayors.
summary: The current mayor of New York City has diverged from his predecessors by joining the striking nurses. Past labor disputes have often involved scolding.
